Value.description:
Auto increments the version and build number of your application every time a change has been made and stores it in version.h with easy to use variable declarations. Also have a feature for committing changes a la SVN style, a version scheme editor and a change log generator.
Example:
#include "version.h" printf("v%d.%d.%d.%d",MAJOR,MINOR,BUILD,REVISION); //C example string version = AutoVersion::FULLVERSION_STRING; //C++ example
Declarations available in the AutoVersion namespace on C++ and global on C:
1) Date Version Types static const char DATE[] static const char MONTH[] static const char YEAR[] static const double UBUNTU_VERSION_STYLE
2) Software Status static const char STATUS[] static const char STATUS_SHORT[]
3) Standard Version Type static const long MAJOR static const long MINOR static const long BUILD static const long REVISION
4) Miscellaneous Version Types static const long BUILDS_COUNT #define RC_FILEVERSION #define RC_FILEVERSION_STRING static const char FULLVERSION_STRING[]
5) SVN Version static const char SVN_REVISION[] static const char SVN_DATE[]
